text: and the processor is just generating cache misses
and cache misses turn into i need this cache line and, those are requests to the memory controller
the memory controller takes all these requests for cache lines and translates those into
memory channel requests which is like i need this bank, this byte, this row
so the memory controller is mapping physical linear addresses to spots in a dram array, now the memory controller is getting
just kind of, random cache misses, whatever the algorithm does
and what any modern memory controller does is
it just starts enqueuing those and buffers them up

and then reorders all of those cache misses such that if it can find requests that it needs to make to the same bank or sorry to the same row, it will reorder the requests in order to maximize this sort of hit rate
so it's gonna basically reorder all the processor's memory requests
in order to try and get the highest bank pipelining and the highest row buffer locality
